definition: to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
(idiom) to teach in line with the student's ability

sentences.english: However, Group B patients enjoyed conventional care instead of special care.
sentences.chinese: 乙組按常規護理，不對照顧者進行特殊施教。

sentences.english: Because people teach, do the individual education well.
sentences.chinese: 因人施教，做好個別教育。

sentences.english: Teach students in accordance with their aptitude and enable them to develop their personalities limitlessly.
sentences.chinese: 因材施教能使學生的個性才能得到最大限度的發揮。

sentences.english: The key of exerting the go-aheadism of students is teaching for everybody.
sentences.chinese: 因人施教是發揮學生主動性的要害。

sentences.english: School-children are taught according to age groups.
sentences.chinese: 學童是按年齡分組施教的。

sentences.english: And he taught in their synagogues, and was magnified by all.
sentences.chinese: 他在他們的會堂內施教，受到衆人的稱揚。

sentences.english: It is as clear as crystal that those only teachers could enable the students to receive the custom-tailored education.
sentences.chinese: 只有老師才能幫助學生獲得因材施教的教育。

sentences.english: Thousands of years ago Confucius had the notion of teaching students according to their specific aptitude.
sentences.chinese: 幾千年前，孔子就有“因材施教”的概念。

definition: (idiom) to teach in line with the student's ability
education for everyone, irrespective of background
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
to lecture on doctrine/to expound the wisdom of ancient sages/to preach/a sermon
Imperial scholar from the Ming Dynasty onwards
junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
